GeneralInformation.Vice Principal: MR SHAH JAHAN B MOHAMED IQBAL
GeneralInformation.School Vision: Motivated Learners, Critical Thinkers, Leaders of Character .
GeneralInformation.School Mission: To nurture individuals into lifelong learners and responsible citizens through a well-rounded education.
GeneralInformation.School Philosophy, Culture and Ethos: School Values - 'WE GR2Ow' represents our school's core values in which every individual strives to be Wise, Enterprising, Gracious, Responsible, Resilient and Open to achieve the school's mission and deepen the Singapore Spirit.  School Motto - Guidance to Wisdom The school motto is derived from the initials of GreenWood, GW. It encapsulates the school's belief that lifelong learning anchored on strong values coupled with thinking skills is the foundation to guide our pupils to meet the challenges of the future.   School Culture - We C4ARE IN GWPS  GWPS is a school where pupils and staff have meaningful fun while developing integrity, compassion, commitment and positive attitudes towards lifelong learning. The pupils and staff are actively involved in coaching, continuous learning and innovation to make a difference in themselves and in others. With our niche programmes* for student leadership and community, we strive for our pupils and staff to develop Pride, Happiness and Confidence to meet the challenges of the future.  Learning Environment - POISE (High Pupil Ownership, Innovative Teaching & Learning, High Stakeholder Engagement) GWPS fosters joy in learning through high pupil ownership and innovative teaching and learning. The pupils construct knowledge and apply various thinking skills and systems to derive alternative solutions and perspectives which relate to real-life problems they experience in the community. The school partners stakeholders to create platforms for pupils to practise entrepreneurship and innovation so that they have the confidence to learn new things and take on new challenges in their life.
GeneralInformation.Type of School: GOVERNMENT SCHOOL / CO-ED SCHOOL / SINGLE SESSION

School Distinctive Programmes.Community Service & Student Leadership: WHIZZ - We are Thinking, Inventive and Zealous KIdZ to serve the community

SpecialProgrammes.Special Student Development Programmes O: LLP* - WHIZZ (We are THinking, Innovative and Zealous KidZ to serve the community) The school believes that character and leadership education provides the moral compass for the pupils to overcome challenges in the ever-changing global landscape.  WHIZZ adopts a values-based inquiry approach. Platforms are created inside and outside classrooms to allow pupils to apply thinking skills and systems such as Appreciative Inquiry (AI), Systems Thinking, 6 Thinking Hats, PDCA (Plan, Do, Check, Action) Cycle and Design Thinking tools in an intentional process to derive new, alternative solutions and perspectives that relate to real-life problems. WHIZZ develops personal effectiveness and enables pupils in reflective, critical and creative thinking to create positive impacts on society.  The WHIZZ curriculum comprises of the following programmes: -CareIn (Character Infusion) -Project Work -Values in the Woods -Enchanting Experiences (EE), a partnership with Asian Civilisations Museum -Collaborations with Community for WHIZZ -Values in Action (VIA)  ALP* - BLISS (Bilingual Literature ApprecIation Student Series) In our efforts to encourage effective bilingualism competencies among our pupils, the school has developed the school's second distinctive programme, an Applied Learning Programme which consists of inquiry with literature appreciation, BLISS.  BLISS is a literature appreciation programme for our pupils. Our pupils are introduced and required to practise Socratic Questioning and Philosophy for Children to develop 21st century skills such as inventive and critical thinking, collaboration, communication and information skills. Through the literature discussion, pupils are encouraged to apply reasoning and argumentative skills to construct meaning and opinions as well as linking these to societal concerns in the real world. They will also be able to relate children literature to our school values namely, Wise, Enterprising, Gracious, Responsible, Resilient and Open.
